data.title: The Pilgrim's Progress by John Bunyan: Fair Hardcover (1864) 1st Thus.
data.meta_description: 1st Thus. - Hardcover - Thomas Nelson & Sons., London. - 1864 - Condition: Fair - XXXvi pp + 239 pages inc 9 page index, with a mounted photo frontis and circular vignette photo title page of Bunyan's House in Elsow by Cundall, Downes & Co, of London with the resident female standing in the doorway, with the other photo of his tomb in Bunhill Fields, also a printed title page. Also 9 engraved plates with tissue guards, ornate embossed gilt and blind stamped dark purple cloth some light rubbing and a slight lean out-of-true, bevelled edges, inscription on FFEP, "John Reynolds from his affectionate aunt M. A. Denton 3rd September, 1864". The book is heavily foxed on both title pages and endpapers and the plates, strangely not affecting th prints themselves but the guards and backs, mainly, contents firm and mainly free of the foxing. Small octavo. *1st printing like this with the photos and an early photographic book, the figure in the doorway is probably the tenant a Ms Fox? The house was demolished in 1969 for another house's driveway? - The Pilgrim's Progress
data.text:
Description:

XXXvi pp + 239 pages inc 9 page index, with a mounted photo frontis and circular vignette photo title page of Bunyan's House in Elsow by Cundall, Downes & Co, of London with the resident female standing in the doorway, with the other photo of his tomb in Bunhill Fields, also a printed title page. Also 9 engraved plates with tissue guards, ornate embossed gilt and blind stamped dark purple cloth some light rubbing and a slight lean out-of-true, bevelled edges, inscription on FFEP, "John Reynolds from his affectionate aunt M. A. Denton 3rd September, 1864". The book is heavily foxed on both title pages and endpapers and the plates, strangely not affecting th prints themselves but the guards and backs, mainly, contents firm and mainly free of the foxing. Small octavo. *1st printing like this with the photos and an early photographic book, the figure in the doorway is probably the tenant a Ms Fox? The house was demolished in 1969 for another house's driveway?. Seller Inventory # A963

The Pilgrim's Progress

Bunyan, John

Published by Airmont Publishing, 1969

ISBN 10: 080490183X / ISBN 13: 9780804901833

Used / Mass Market Paperback

Quantity: 1 available

Seller: Library House Internet Sales, Grand Rapids, OH, U.S.A.

Seller Rating:

Mass Market Paperback. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. Due to age and/or environmental conditions, the pages of this book have darkened. Solid binding. Please note the image in this listing is a stock photo and may not match the covers of the actual item. Book. Seller Inventory # 123532719

Contact seller
